questions.question: What is the average Global Sales for each Genre?
questions.hint: Group by Genre and compute mean of Global_Sales.

questions.question: What proportion of games have Global Sales greater than 1 million units?
questions.hint: Calculate the mean of the boolean condition Global_Sales > 1.0.

questions.question: Which Platform has the highest average Global Sales among the top 10 platforms by game count?
questions.hint: Filter to the 10 most frequent platforms, group by Platform, compute mean Global_Sales, then select the max.

questions.question: What is the Pearson correlation between NA_Sales and EU_Sales?
questions.hint: Use df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales']].corr().loc['NA_Sales','EU_Sales'].

questions.question: Which Year has the highest total Global Sales (sum of Global_Sales per Year)?
questions.hint: Group by Year, sum Global_Sales, then find the Year with max total.

questions.question: Is there a significant difference in average Global Sales between Action and Sports genres?
questions.hint: Perform an independent two‑sample t‑test on Global_Sales for the two genres.

questions.question: Does the Year of release predict Global Sales? Fit a simple linear regression (Global_Sales ~ Year) and report the slope and p‑value.
questions.hint: Use statsmodels OLS: sm.OLS(df['Global_Sales'], sm.add_constant(df['Year'])).fit().

questions.question: Are sales distributions across regions (NA, EU, JP, Other) independent of the Genre? Conduct a chi‑square test on a contingency table of Genre vs dominant region (region with highest sales for each game).
questions.hint: Create a column with the region having max sales per row, then pd.crosstab(Genre, dominant_region) and scipy.stats.chi2_contingency.

questions.question: What is the average Global Sales for the top 5 Publishers by game count?
questions.hint: Identify top 5 publishers, filter, group by Publisher, compute mean Global_Sales.

questions.question: Does the correlation between Year and Global Sales differ across Genres? Compute Pearson correlation between Year and Global_Sales for each Genre with at least 200 games.
questions.hint: Filter Genres with count >=200, then for each compute df_genre['Year'].corr(df_genre['Global_Sales']).

questions.question: Build a multiple linear regression model to predict Global Sales using NA, EU, JP, and Other regional sales. Report R‑squared and the most influential predictor.
questions.hint: Use sm.OLS(Global_Sales, sm.add_constant(df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']])).fit().

questions.question: Perform a one‑way ANOVA to test whether mean Global Sales differ among the top 4 Genres (Action, Sports, Role‑Playing, Shooter).
questions.hint: Use scipy.stats.f_oneway on the Global_Sales arrays of each selected Genre.

questions.question: Is there a significant interaction effect between Platform and Genre on Global Sales? Fit a two‑way ANOVA with interaction.
questions.hint: Create a model: Global_Sales ~ C(Platform) * C(Genre) using statsmodels.formula.api.ols.

questions.question: Using a train‑test split (80/20, random_state=42), train a linear regression model to predict Global Sales from Year and Platform (one‑hot encoded). Report test RMSE.
questions.hint: Split with sklearn.model_selection.train_test_split, OneHotEncoder for Platform, fit LinearRegression, compute mean_squared_error on test set.

questions.question: Build a ridge regression model (alpha=1.0) to predict Global Sales from all numeric features (Year, NA_Sales, EU_Sales, JP_Sales, Other_Sales). Use 5‑fold cross‑validation (random_state=42). Report average CV R‑squared.
questions.hint: Use sklearn.linear_model.Ridge with cross_val_score, cv=5, scoring='r2'.

questions.question: Create a bootstrap confidence interval (95%) for the mean Global Sales of games released after 2010.
questions.hint: Resample the subset df[df['Year']>2010]['Global_Sales'] 1000 times, compute mean each, take 2.5th and 97.5th percentiles.

questions.question: Does the distribution of Global Sales differ between games published by Nintendo and Electronic Arts? Use a Kolmogorov‑Smirnov test.
questions.hint: Extract Global_Sales for each publisher and apply scipy.stats.ks_2samp.

questions.question: What is the median Global Sales for each Year? Identify any year where the median exceeds 1.0.
questions.hint: Group by Year and compute median of Global_Sales, then filter where median > 1.0.

questions.question: Calculate the share of total Global Sales contributed by the top 10 games.
questions.hint: Sum Global_Sales of the 10 highest‑selling games and divide by total Global_Sales.

questions.question: Is there a monotonic relationship between Year and Global Sales? Compute Spearman rank correlation.
questions.hint: Use df['Year'].corr(df['Global_Sales'], method='spearman').

questions.question: For each Platform, what proportion of its games have Global Sales above the overall mean Global Sales?
questions.hint: Compute overall mean, then group by Platform and calculate mean of (Global_Sales > overall_mean).

questions.question: Do games released in the 1990s have higher average NA Sales than those released in the 2000s? Perform an independent t‑test.
questions.hint: Create two subsets (1990‑1999, 2000‑2009) and run scipy.stats.ttest_ind on NA_Sales.

questions.question: What is the variance inflation factor (VIF) for each predictor in the multiple regression model (NA, EU, JP, Other) predicting Global Sales?
questions.hint: Fit OLS, then use statsmodels.stats.outliers_influence.variance_inflation_factor on the design matrix.

questions.question: Identify the top 3 Genres with the greatest increase in average Global Sales from the 1990s to the 2000s.
questions.hint: Compute mean Global_Sales per Genre for 1990‑1999 and 2000‑2009, calculate difference, sort descending.

questions.question: Using hierarchical clustering (Ward linkage) on regional sales columns, how many clusters best separate the games? Determine using the dendrogram cutoff at distance 1.5.
questions.hint: Apply scipy.cluster.hierarchy.linkage on df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']], then fcluster with t=1.5, method='distance'.

questions.question: Predict whether a game will achieve Global Sales > 1 million using a logistic regression model with Year, Platform (one‑hot), and Genre (one‑hot) as features. Report test accuracy (random_state=42).
questions.hint: Create binary target, split data, encode categoricals, fit sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression, compute accuracy_score.

questions.question: Perform a permutation test (10,000 permutations) to assess if the mean Global Sales of Nintendo games differs from the overall mean.
questions.hint: Compute observed difference, repeatedly shuffle the Nintendo label, recalculate difference, estimate p‑value.

questions.question: Using a random forest regressor (n_estimators=200, random_state=42), predict Global Sales from all features (including one‑hot encoded categorical variables). Report the top 5 most important features.
questions.hint: Encode categoricals, fit RandomForestRegressor, access feature_importances_, sort.
